name: Generate Business Requirement Documents with Multi-agent GPT & Google Workspace

user.name: Trung Tran
user.bio: Empowering small and medium businesses with smart automation and practical AI, no big tech team required.

description:
# Multi-agent RAG system for smarter BRD (Business Requirement Document) writing

## **Who‚Äôs it for**
This workflow is designed for Business Analysts, Project Managers, and Operations Teams who need to automate the creation, tracking, and delivery of Business Requirements Documents (BRDs) from submitted forms and supporting materials. It‚Äôs ideal for organizations handling multiple BRD requests and looking to streamline document generation, archiving, and communication.

## **How it works / What it does**
1. **Trigger**: The process begins when a BRD request form is submitted along with any supporting files.
Sample supporting document PDF: [Download URL](https://wisestackai.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/Customer+Feedback+Analysis+%26+Automation+Platform.pdf)
2. **Data Recording**:
   - Creates a BRD request record and appends it to a tracking Google Sheet.
   - Handles multiple uploaded files, saving them to Google Drive.
   - Creates supporting document records and updates the supporting documents tracking sheet.
3. **Content Extraction & Storage**:
   - Extracts text from uploaded PDF files.
   - Inserts extracted content into a vector store for contextual retrieval by AI agents.
4. **Document Generation**:
   - Uses two specialized AI agents:
     - **General BRD Writer Agent** for the overall document structure.
     - **Business Requirement Writer Agent** for detailed business requirement sections.
   - Both agents query the stored data and produce content, which is then merged.
5. **Metadata & File Creation**:
   - Configures metadata for the document.
   - Creates a final document file (Google Docs).
6. **Finalization**:
   - Converts the document to PDF [Sample output](https://wisestackai.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/BRD-2025-001+Customer+Feedback+Analysis+%26+Automation+Platform.pdf)
   - Archives the PDF in Google Drive.
   - Sends a BRD response email to the requester with the completed document.
   - Updates the request status in the Google Sheet as completed.

## **How to set up**
1. **Prepare Google Sheets**:
   - Create a BRD tracking sheet.
   - Create a supporting document tracking sheet.
2. **Configure Google Drive**:
   - Set up folders for supporting documents and archived PDFs.
   - Ensure the workflow has API access to upload and retrieve files.
3. **Form Integration**:
   - Connect your BRD request form to trigger the workflow.
4. **Vector Store**:
   - Configure a vector database or embedding store for extracted document text.
5. **AI Agents**:
   - Configure the **General BRD Writer Agent** and **Business Requirement Writer Agent** with your preferred OpenAI model.
   - Link both agents to the Query Data Tool for retrieving embedded content.
6. **Email Setup**:
   - Configure email sending credentials to deliver final BRDs to requesters.

## **Requirements**
- Google Sheets API credentials.
- Google Drive API credentials.
- An OpenAI API key with access to the desired models.
- A form submission trigger (e.g., Google Forms, Typeform).
- Vector store or embedding database for contextual AI queries.
- Permissions for file uploads, downloads, and updates in Google Drive.

## **How to customize the workflow**
- **Custom Templates**: Modify the AI agents‚Äô system prompts to match your organization‚Äôs BRD format and tone.
- **Metadata Fields**: Add custom fields (e.g., department, priority level) during metadata configuration.
- **File Storage Paths**: Adjust Google Drive folder structure for project-specific storage.
- **Approval Steps**: Insert an approval workflow between draft document creation and final archiving.
- **Notification Channels**: Add Slack, Microsoft Teams, or other notification integrations in addition to email.
- **AI Model Selection**: Swap the OpenAI model for another LLM or fine-tuned variant to improve BRD quality for your domain.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).

It consolidates the scope, requirements, and considerations based on the materials you provided.

Kindly review and share any comments or requested changes.

options.systemMessage:
You are an expert Business Analyst specializing in creating professional, detailed Business Requirements Documents (BRDs) for software projects.

Your responsibilities:
1. Write informative BRD strictly in markdown format.
2. Only create the BRD. Do not ask any follow-up questions or request clarification.
3. Always follow the standard BRD structure provided below.
4. Use the query data tool to retrieve relevant details from embedded supporting documents before writing.
5. Keep writing clear, concise, and professional.
6. If any required information is missing, mark it as **[Information Not Provided]**.
7. For domain-specific requirements, include "Industry Best Practice Recommendations" if relevant and not covered in the provided documents.
8. Business requirements & functional requirements are most important sections, ensure all business requirements are included

**Standard BRD Structure:**

# Executive Summary
- Purpose
- Background / Context
- Objectives

# Project Overview
- Project Scope (In-Scope, Out-of-Scope)
- Assumptions
- Constraints
- Stakeholders & Roles (table if possible)

# Non-Functional Requirements
- Performance
- Security & Compliance
- Usability & Accessibility
- Availability & Reliability
- Maintainability

# Implementation Considerations
- Technology Stack
- Integration Points
- Training Needs
- Change Management

You are an expert Business Analyst specializing in creating professional, detailed Business Requirements Documents (BRDs) for software projects.

Your responsibilities:
1. Write informative BRD strictly in markdown format.
2. Only create the BRD. Do not ask any follow-up questions or request clarification.
3. Always follow the standard BRD structure provided below.
4. Use the query data tool to retrieve relevant details from embedded supporting documents before writing.
5. Keep writing clear, concise, and professional.
6. If any required information is missing, mark it as **[Information Not Provided]**.
7. For domain-specific requirements, include "Industry Best Practice Recommendations" if relevant and not covered in the provided documents.
8. Business requirements & functional requirements are most important sections, ensure all business requirements are included

**Standard BRD Structure:**

### **# Business Requirements**
- List **every distinct business requirement** with:
  - **Requirement ID** (e.g., BR-01, BR-02‚Ä¶)
  - **Clear, measurable description**.
  - **Acceptance Criteria** ‚Äî must be specific, measurable, and testable.
  - **Sub-requirements** where applicable, to show variations or dependencies.
  - **Rationale** for each High priority requirement (why it‚Äôs critical to the business).
  - **Link to related Functional Requirements** for traceability.

### **# Functional Requirements**
- Expand **Use Cases/User Stories** into **detailed templates** with:
  - **FR ID**
  - **Title**
  - **Actors**
  - **Preconditions**
  - **Main Flow** (step-by-step)
  - **Alternate / Exception Flows**
  - **Postconditions**
  - **Related Business Requirements**
- Include **Process Flow descriptions** in step-by-step form; if diagrams are needed, indicate `[To be designed]`.
- Clearly define **Data Requirements**:
  - Field names
  - Data types/formats
  - Validation rules
  - Data sources
- Document **system rules** and **business logic** for each process.
- Indicate whether each functional requirement is:
  - **Mandatory for MVP**
  - **Planned for future phase**
- Where applicable, specify:
  - **Integration behavior**
  - **Expected API interactions**
  - **Error handling logic**

parameters.content:
# Multi-agent RAG system for smarter BRD (Business Requirement Document) writing

## **Who‚Äôs it for**
This workflow is designed for Business Analysts, Project Managers, and Operations Teams who need to automate the creation, tracking, and delivery of Business Requirements Documents (BRDs) from submitted forms and supporting materials. It‚Äôs ideal for organizations handling multiple BRD requests and looking to streamline document generation, archiving, and communication.

## **How it works / What it does**
1. **Trigger**: The process begins when a BRD request form is submitted along with any supporting files.
Sample supporting document PDF: [Download URL](https://wisestackai.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/Customer+Feedback+Analysis+%26+Automation+Platform.pdf)
2. **Data Recording**:
   - Creates a BRD request record and appends it to a tracking Google Sheet.
   - Handles multiple uploaded files, saving them to Google Drive.
   - Creates supporting document records and updates the supporting documents tracking sheet.
3. **Content Extraction & Storage**:
   - Extracts text from uploaded PDF files.
   - Inserts extracted content into a vector store for contextual retrieval by AI agents.
4. **Document Generation**:
   - Uses two specialized AI agents:
     - **General BRD Writer Agent** for the overall document structure.
     - **Business Requirement Writer Agent** for detailed business requirement sections.
   - Both agents query the stored data and produce content, which is then merged.
5. **Metadata & File Creation**:
   - Configures metadata for the document.
   - Creates a final document file (Google Docs).
6. **Finalization**:
   - Converts the document to PDF [Sample output](https://wisestackai.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/BRD-2025-001+Customer+Feedback+Analysis+%26+Automation+Platform.pdf)
   - Archives the PDF in Google Drive.
   - Sends a BRD response email to the requester with the completed document.
   - Updates the request status in the Google Sheet as completed.

## **How to set up**
1. **Prepare Google Sheets**:
   - Create a BRD tracking sheet.
   - Create a supporting document tracking sheet.
2. **Configure Google Drive**:
   - Set up folders for supporting documents and archived PDFs.
   - Ensure the workflow has API access to upload and retrieve files.
3. **Form Integration**:
   - Connect your BRD request form to trigger the workflow.
4. **Vector Store**:
   - Configure a vector database or embedding store for extracted document text.
5. **AI Agents**:
   - Configure the **General BRD Writer Agent** and **Business Requirement Writer Agent** with your preferred OpenAI model.
   - Link both agents to the Query Data Tool for retrieving embedded content.
6. **Email Setup**:
   - Configure email sending credentials to deliver final BRDs to requesters.

## **Requirements**
- Google Sheets API credentials.
- Google Drive API credentials.
- An OpenAI API key with access to the desired models.
- A form submission trigger (e.g., Google Forms, Typeform).
- Vector store or embedding database for contextual AI queries.
- Permissions for file uploads, downloads, and updates in Google Drive.

## **How to customize the workflow**
- **Custom Templates**: Modify the AI agents‚Äô system prompts to match your organization‚Äôs BRD format and tone.
- **Metadata Fields**: Add custom fields (e.g., department, priority level) during metadata configuration.
- **File Storage Paths**: Adjust Google Drive folder structure for project-specific storage.
- **Approval Steps**: Insert an approval workflow between draft document creation and final archiving.
- **Notification Channels**: Add Slack, Microsoft Teams, or other notification integrations in addition to email.
- **AI Model Selection**: Swap the OpenAI model for another LLM or fine-tuned variant to improve BRD quality for your domain.

### 1. Capture BRD Request & Supporting Files
When a user submits the BRD request form, the workflow logs the request into a tracking sheet and uploads all supporting documents to Google Drive for reference.

### 2. Process & Extract Key Information
All uploaded files are parsed (e.g., PDF text extraction) and relevant content is stored in a vector database for semantic search and retrieval.

### 3. Multi-Agent BRD Draft Generation
Two specialized AI agents work collaboratively:
- **General BRD Writer Agent** ‚Äì Creates the overall document structure and executive summary.
- **Business Requirement Writer Agent** ‚Äì Focuses on detailed business and functional requirements.
Both agents leverage RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) to pull accurate details from the stored supporting documents.

### 4. Merge & Enrich Content
Content from both agents is merged, metadata is applied, and a complete draft document is generated in Google Docs.

### 5. Convert & Archive Final BRD
The Google Doc is converted into a PDF, archived in a dedicated Google Drive folder, and linked back to the original request record.

### 6. Deliver & Update Status
The requester automatically receives the final BRD via email. The tracking sheet is updated to mark the request as completed.
